Candentity.desc: H3N8 is a subtype of the Influenza A virus that is endemic in birds, horses, dogs, and seals, and can also infect cats experimentally, causing clinical signs and shedding of the virus.

Candentity.name: Influenza_A_virus
Candentity.desc: Influenza A virus is a negative-sense, single-stranded, segmented RNA virus that causes influenza in birds and some mammals, with various subtypes labeled according to H and N numbers and capable of mutating into different strains with varying pathogenic profiles.

Candentity.name: Influenza_A_virus_subtype_H5N6

Candentity.name: DNA_virus

Candentity.name: Influenza_A_virus_subtype_H7N7
Candentity.desc: Influenza A virus subtype H7N7 is a subtype of the influenza A virus that has caused outbreaks of low and high pathogenicity in various countries, including the Netherlands, England, Spain, China, and Australia, resulting in the culling of thousands of chickens and suspension of poultry imports.

Candentity.name: Influenza_B_virus
Candentity.desc: Influenza B virus is a species of Orthomyxoviridae that infects only humans and seals, with two circulating lineages and a slower mutation rate than Influenza A virus, but can still cause significant morbidity and mortality worldwide, particularly among adolescents and schoolchildren.

Candentity.name: Influenza_A_virus_subtype_H5N2
Candentity.desc: Influenza A virus subtype H5N2 is a bird-infecting virus that can cause mild to severe illness in birds, with occasional outbreaks in poultry farms, and can also infect humans who work with birds, but with minimal health effects and no evidence of human-to-human transmission.

Candentity.name: Influenza_D_virus
Candentity.desc: Influenza D virus is a species of Orthomyxoviridae that causes influenza in pigs and cattle, but no human infections have been observed, and it is distinct from previously-known Influenzavirus C.

Candentity.name: Influenza_A_virus_subtype_H7N9
Candentity.desc: Influenza A virus subtype H7N9 is a highly pathogenic and potentially pandemic-causing virus that has a mortality rate of around 30% and has been linked to live bird markets, with a high incidence among older males.

1273.mention_context: The Space Shuttle Discovery launched on its final mission, STS-133 (crew pictured), today.

Candentity.name: Discovery_(Electric_Light_Orchestra_album)
Candentity.desc: Discovery is the eighth studio album by English rock band Electric Light Orchestra, released in 1979 and topping record charts in the UK and US.

Candentity.name: Land_Rover_Discovery
Candentity.desc: The Land Rover Discovery is a mid-size SUV.

Candentity.name: Discovery_History
Candentity.desc: Discovery History is a British television channel owned by Discovery Inc.

Candentity.name: Web_Services_Discovery
Candentity.desc: Web_Services_Discovery is a process that enables access to software systems over the Internet using standard protocols, allowing service providers to publish services and consumers to discover and use them.

Candentity.name: Discovery_One
Candentity.desc: Discovery One is a fictional nuclear-powered interplanetary spaceship in the Space Odyssey series, crewed by two men and controlled by the AI HAL 9000, featured in novels and films 2001.

Candentity.name: Discovery_(band)
Candentity.desc: Discovery is an American indie rock and electronic recording project formed by friends Rostam Batmanglij and Wesley Miles in 2005.

Candentity.name: Crew
Candentity.desc: A crew is a group of people working together in a structured organization, often with a hierarchical chain of command, with origins in nautical settings and also referring to the sport of rowing.

Candentity.name: Space_Shuttle_Discovery
Candentity.desc: Space Shuttle Discovery is one of NASA's five fully operational orbiters, launched in 1984, and flew 39 missions over 27 years, carrying out research, International Space Station assembly, and Hubble Space Telescope deployment, before being retired and now on display at the Smithsonian National Air and Space Museum.

Candentity.name: Electronic_discovery
Candentity.desc: Electronic discovery refers to the process of discovering and reviewing electronic information, such as emails and documents, in legal proceedings, governed by rules of civil procedure and involving review for privilege and relevance.

Candentity.name: Discovery_II
Candentity.desc: Discovery II is a sternwheel riverboat built in 1971, still in operation as a tour vessel on the Chena and Tanana rivers near Fairbanks, Alaska.
